summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing coordination with the SDNY regarding a press release about Prince Andrew's response to an MLAT request. It also provides an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, including planned indictment charges and surveillance activities.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of MLAT request and investigation
persons.context: His counsel is issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY prosecutors. There have been conversations about interviewing him.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in the email chain; the sender is providing him with updates on the Prince Andrew MLAT and Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The FBI details plans to indict her on six counts, has a mail cover on her suspected address, renewed a Pen register for her phone, and plans surveillance.

connections.description: Both are subjects of investigation in the same overarching Epstein case, as discussed in the same FBI email update.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Counsel Issues Statement
events.description: Prince Andrew's counsel is issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request from SDNY prosecutors.

events.title: SDNY Plans Press Statement
events.description: The SDNY has plans to issue a statement in response to Prince Andrew's counsel's public statement; drafts are being made.

events.title: Planned Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI plans to seek a six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell when a grand jury is available. The charges include conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and two counts of perjury.

events.title: Surveillance and Monitoring of Maxwell
events.description: The FBI has a mail cover on an address believed to be Maxwell's, renewed a Pen register for her phone, and hopes to conduct surveillance of the location.

keyFacts: In June 2020, Prince Andrew's counsel was preparing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY prosecutors, and the SDNY planned to issue a counter-statement.
The FBI detailed a planned six-count criminal indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, including charges for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury.
Active investigative measures against Maxwell were underway, including a mail cover on her suspected address, a renewed Pen register for her phone, and planned physical surveillance.
The email indicates coordination between the FBI's New York field office and the SDNY regarding public messaging and investigative steps in the Epstein case.
